WebRTC

  1. Signalling

é–‹å•Ÿç›´æ’­çš„Peeréœ€è¦æä¾›ä¸€å€‹offerï¼Œè£¡é¢åŒ…å«SDP(session description protocol)ï¼Œæœƒå¯«åœ¨signal serverï¼Œæ‰èƒ½è®“å¦ä¸€ä½çš„peerå›æ‡‰é€™å€‹SDPã€‚

  • IP Address

  1. Connecting

Peerå½¼æ­¤ä¹‹é–“éœ€è¦ç”¢ç”Ÿä¸€å€‹listçš„ICE(IP/port pair)ï¼Œæ‰èƒ½è®“WebRTCé€éSTUN Serveré€£æ¥ã€‚ æ¯å€‹Peerä¸€æ¨£è¦å°‡ä»–å€‘çš„ICEå¯«å…¥firestoreï¼Œæ‰èƒ½è®“å…¶ä»–peerè®€åˆ°ã€‚

  • ICE: Interactive connectivity establishment (uses STUN/TURN servers)
    • STUN Standard Traversal Utilities for NAT
      • å¹«å¿™å–å¾—ç¶²è·¯IP -> é€éç™¼é€Stun serverè«‹æ±‚
    • TURN Traversal Using Relays around NAT
      • å¹«å¿™è™•ç†è£ç½®ä¹‹é–“å› ç‚ºé˜²ç«ç‰†è€Œä¸­æ–·é€£ç·šçš„server
      • These servers are used to work up with the privacy of the agents by not letting the servers locate the IP of the communicators. TURN creates a temporary IP for the agents to generate traffic to and fro, acting as a proxy.
  1. Securing
  • DTLS(Datagram Transport Layer Security)
    • allows webRTC to establish a secured and encrypted communication between two peers. The client and the server to communicate, need a agree on certain values known as ciphers in a DTLS handshake. To secure the data streams of the peers, DTLS is required
  • SRTP(Secure Real-time Transport Protocol)
    • It secures and encrypts the media streams between two connecting peers. It is initialized by using keys generated by DTLS. This protocol is specifically designed for encrypting RTP packets.

noteIndex.body:
## Welcome to my learning repository! ğŸ“š

**Disclaimer:**

The content in this repository is a work in progress and should not be considered an authoritative source of information. These notes are currently being compiled during my learning journey at AppWorks School. They are subject to change, and there may be gaps in organization and accuracy.

**Note Status:**

I am actively working on organizing and rectifying any inaccuracies. Expect a more comprehensive set of notes by 2024/01/19.

**Reading guide:**

> Block quotes like this generally means this paragraph is quoted by official documentation.

```swift
// Example code is typically simplified and may not be practical in real-world scenarios.
// It is created solely to aid my understanding of the underlying concepts related to a specific topic.
```

Feel free to connect with me and share your thoughts or suggestions regarding my note-taking process. I appreciate any feedback and collaboration to enhance the quality of these notes.

Happy learning! ğŸš€
